review_title: Great place to donate to, Amazing Organization, Extremely beneficial for homeless youth, amazing place to work
pros:
- Very well paid: I applied to volunteer but I had applicable skills and they hired me and paid me for extensive training 
- My boss was incredibly empathetic to my mental health. I was able to take naps during my lunch break. Everyone I worked with was so kind and so engaged and smart. Especially my supervisor.
- The Cooking For Life program was amazing, students made extra food and the chef brought some for me at lunch most times I was there (maybe everytime!
- They have a harm reduction model, which is something I believe in deeply, and I think it’s great they offer that because abstinence doesn’t work for everybody 
As a note, if you want to donate, it’s great to offer clothes but when I worked there that was frequently called about and my assumption from what I gathered is that there were too many clothes and a financial donation or time spent volunteering or even working for this organization is much more valuable.
cons: - The only con I can think of is that the residents used drugs close to the property, which is not to say at all that there should be stigma or criminalization of any kind, but I wish there had been perhaps more monitoring of that as I think it contributes to said stigma and because if it is so common and accepted around other residents it can be extremely harmful.
